required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Qualitative Assessment of the Impact of the Connected Catheter on Quality of Life and Participation
clinical_study.official_title: Qualitative Assessment of the Impact of the Connected Catheter on Quality of Life and Participation

brief_summary.textblock: This study through the use of semi-structured interviews or focus groups will explore the lived experience with a Connected Catheter and usual customary care (UCC) of catheter users with Neurogenic Lower Urinary Tract Dysfunction and their caretakers to generate user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life.

detailed_description.textblock: Identify NLUTD user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life Specific Aim: Using iterative, semi-structured interviews or focus groups to explore the lived experience with CC and usual customary care (UCC) of catheter users with NLUTD and their caretakers to generate user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at completion of connected catheter study, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Explores the lived experience with the connected catheter and usual customary care (UCC) of catheter users with neurogenic lower urinary tract dysfunction to generate user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life. Qualitative analysis to define themes

primary_outcome.time_frame: at completion of connected catheter study, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Explores the lived experience with the connected catheter and usual customary care (UCC) of caretakers for catheter users with neurogenic lower urinary tract dysfunction to generate user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life. Qualitative analysis to define themes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year following outcome 1 and 2 collection
secondary_outcome.description: Possible follow-up calls for clarification on user-defined themes that emerge.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Subjects who used a Connected Catheter
arm_group.description: Subjects will have Neurogenic Lower Urinary Tract Dysfunction and will have participated in a study with a Connected Catheter. These characteristics will create a 2 (bladder management) x ~5 (etiology) = 10 cell matrix for recruiting for participant interviews.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Caregiver of Subject who used a Connected Catheter
arm_group.description: Caregiver (n=20) interviews will be done for those who care for individuals with similar bladder managements and etiologies.

intervention.description: Using iterative, semi-structured interviews or focus groups to explore the lived experience with CC and usual customary care (UCC) of catheter users with NLUTD and their caretakers to generate user-defined themes regarding bladder function and catheter-related barriers and the daily impacts on one's life.
intervention.arm_group_label: Caregiver of Subject who used a Connected Catheter
Subjects who used a Connected Catheter

study_pop.textblock: We will recruit a homogenous group of those with NLUTD, then stratify on usual bladder management and etiology (SB, MS, SCI, stroke, PD). These characteristics will create a 2 (bladder management) x ~5 (etiology) = 10 cell matrix for recruiting for participant interviews. We plan to interview two individuals per cell (n=20) for participant interviews. Caregiver (n=20) interviews will be done for those who care for individuals with similar bladder managements and etiologies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have participated in Connected Catheter Clinical trial Caregiver
- Must have cared for someone that participated in Connected Catheter Clinical trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Did not participate in Connected Catheter Clinical trial
